bio: Usain Bolt is a retired Jamaican sprinter. Regarded as one of the greatest athletes of all time, he is the world and Olympic record holder in the 100 metres, 200 metres and 4 X 100 metres relay. Bolt's dominance in these events saw him win eight Olympic gold medals and twelve world championships. His success in sprint events earned him the nickname "Lightning Bolt" and he became an iconic figure in the sport. Bolt announced his retirement from athletics in 2017, before his final professional race in 2018. He remains a hero and inspiration in Jamaica and throughout the world.

bio: The Heiress (1947 play) is a three-act drama written by American playwright Ruth Goetz and her husband Augustus Goetz. The play is based on the 1880 novella Washington Square by Henry James, focusing on the life of a wealthy young woman named Catherine Sloper, who lives with her father in New York City. The play premiered on Broadway in 1947 and was directed by Jed Harris. It featured a cast that included Franchot Tone, Lloyd George, and Anne Revere. The play was a critical and commercial success and won the 1947 Pulitzer Prize for Drama. It has since been adapted into a feature film twice, in 1949 and 1979. #31 Post by Alan H » May 10th, 2019, 10:53 am

bio: Rick and Morty is an American adult animated science fiction sitcom that premiered on December 2, 2013, on Cartoon Network's late-night programming block Adult Swim. The show is created by Justin Roiland and Dan Harmon. The series follows the misadventures of a bored retiree, Rick Sanchez, and his socially awkward grandson, Morty Smith, as they travel through different dimensions and parallel universes. The show's tone is starkly dark, irreverent, and often surreal, exploring concepts such as nihilism, existentialism, and alternative dimensions. The series has been praised for its improvisational dialogue, dark humor, and exploration of complex philosophical themes, but has also been criticized for its inconsistent tone and depictions of violence and harmful behavior that have been characterized as problematic.

bio: Geraldine Chaplin (born July 28, 1944) is an English actress, the daughter of Charlie Chaplin and his wife Oona O'Neill. She has had a long and diverse career in film, television, and theater. She is perhaps best known for her roles in films such as Doctor Zhivago (1965), A Clockwork Orange (1971), and The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011). She has been nominated for a BAFTA and a Golden Globe Award for her work in the films of Carlos Saura.

bio: The Reader (2008 film) is an award winning German-American drama film directed by Stephen Daldry and written by David Hare. The film is based on the 1995 novel of the same name by Bernhard Schlink. The film's protagonist is a 15-year-old boy named Michael Berg, who becomes ill and is helped home by Hanna, a stranger twice his age. The two have an affair, but Hanna abruptly leaves Germany for six years before suddenly returning and resuming their affair. The film is set in Germany, both before and after World War II, and explores themes such as Holocaust guilt, the difficulty of overcoming the past, and the complex nature of morality and responsibility. Kate Winslet won multiple awards for her performance as Hanna including the Academy Award for Best Actress and David Kross also received critical acclaim for his portrayal of Michael Berg. package main

bio: Emily Ratajkowski (born Emily O'Hara Ratajkowski; June 7, 1991) is an American model and actress. Born in London, she was raised in San Diego, California. Ratajkowski gained prominence after her appearance in the music video for Robin Thicke's "Blurred Lines" in 2013, which became the number one song of the year in the United States. She has since appeared in movies such as Gone Girl (2014), Entourage (2015), and We Are Your Friends (2015). In addition to modeling and acting, she has been a social media personality, with millions of followers across various platforms. Ratajkowski is known for her advocacy for women's rights and body positivity.

bio: The Bridges of Madison County (film) is a 1995 American romantic drama film based on the novel of the same name by Robert James Waller. Directed by Clint Eastwood and written by Richard LaGravenese, it tells the story of a photographer named Robert Kincaid (played by Eastwood) and an Iowan farm wife named Francesca Johnson (played by Meryl Streep) who fall into a romantic affair while he is on assignment to photograph the covered bridges of Madison County, Iowa during the 1960s. The film was shot on location in Madison County, with interior scenes filmed in the nearby town of Winterset. It was released in the United States on July 2, 1995, and grossed over $182 million worldwide, becoming a critical and commercial success. #ThrowbackThursday: The time George Michael crashed his car while driving drunk

bio: Anaconda (Nicki Minaj song) is a song by Trinidadian-American rapper Nicki Minaj, from her third studio album, The Pinkprint (2014). The song features uncredited vocals from Mike Will Made It, who also produced the track. The song was released as the second single from the album on August 4, 2014, through Young Money Entertainment and Cash Money Records. The song received universal acclaim from music critics, who praised its sexual innuendos and its beat. The song was a commercial success, peaking at number two on the US Billboard Hot 100 and becoming Minaj's highest-charting single in the country at the time. The song also reached the top ten in several other countries, including Australia, Canada, the United Kingdom and New Zealand. The song's accompanying music video broke records for the most views in a 24-hour period on Vevo, with over 19.6 million views. #JourneyToSpace – Documentary Film Review

bio: Jerry Maguire is a 1996 American romantic sports comedy-drama film written, produced and directed by Cameron Crowe. It stars Tom Cruise as the titular character, a successful sports agent who suddenly faces professional and personal crises. Cameron Diaz,Kathryn Holcomb, and Cuba Gooding Jr. also star, with Gooding Jr. winning an Academy Award for his performance as Maguire's client and friend, Rod Tidwell. The film also features supporting roles played by Jonathon Lipnicki, Rosi Perez, and Ed Harris. #33 in Nonfiction, Health & Well Being, Psychology, Personality, Self Help

bio: Tom Hiddleston (born 9 February 1981) is an English actor, author, and producer. He made his TV debut in the early 2000s and gained recognition for his role as Loki in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, beginning with Thor (2011). His other prominent film appearances include The Avengers (2012), Cabin in the Woods (2012), and Crimson Peak (2015). Hiddleston has also been active in theatre, including a 2008 production of Cymbeline at the Royal Court Theatre. In 2018 he starred in the Broadway revival of Betrayal. In 2020, he played the title character in the TV miniseries series "Hap and Leonard".

bio: Baahubali: The Beginning is a 2015 Indian epic historical fiction film directed by S. S. Rajamouli, written by Rajamouli and Madhan Karky, and produced by Shobu Yarlagadda, Prasad Devineni, and Ravi Varanasi. The film stars Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Tamannaah, and Anushka Shetty in lead roles; while Ramya Krishnan, Sathyaraj, Nassar, and Adivi Sesh appear in supporting roles. Produced on a budget of around ₹2.5 billion (US$31 million), it was the most expensive Indian film made at the time of its release. The film was released worldwide on 10 July 2015 and received critical acclaim for its direction, cinematography, action sequences, editing, screenplay, production values, and performances, especially Prabhas's and Rana's performances, and has been hailed as a milestone in Indian film industry and one of the best Indian films of all time. It also became one of the highest-grossing Indian films of all time. #MakingStrides for Breast Cancer Research and Awareness

bio: Alive 2006/2007 was a world tour by Italian symphonic gothic metal band Nightwish, in support of their sixth studio album, "Dark Passion Play". It began in October 2006 and ended in 2008. It was one of the most important tours of the band's career and included more than 100 concerts in Europe, North America, South America and Oceania. The tour consisted of two parts: "Astral Romance" and "The Poet and the Pendulum". The second part of the tour was the most successful, with over 50 concerts in Europe and North America. The tour was accompanied by a DVD, "Alive 2007" which was released in 2008, it is considered as one of the best live albums in metal genre. #LoveMe: Giving the gift of self-love this Valentine’s Day

bio: Harry Potter (film series) is a series of fantasy films based on the Harry Potter novels by British author J. K. Rowling. A total of eight films were produced, with the first released in 2001 and the final instalment released in 2011. The film series was produced by David Heyman and stars Daniel Radcliffe as Harry Potter, Rupert Grint as Ron Weasley, and Emma Watson as Hermione Granger. Directed by Chris Columbus, Alfonso Cuarón, Mike Newell, David Yates (for the fourth and fifth films), and Steve Kloves (for the seventh and eighth films), the series spans 10 years in the lives of Harry and his friends, culminating in a series of battles between the light and dark forces of the wizarding world. The series grossed more than $7.7 billion worldwide and has been regarded as one of the most successful film franchises in history. ### Contributing to the project

bio: Muhammad Ali (born Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr.; January 17, 1942 – June 3, 2016) was an American professional boxer and activist. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest pound-for-pound boxers of all time and was known for his charismatic personality, in addition to his athletic prowess in the ring. He was crowned the "World's Greatest Boxer" by The Ring magazine in 1964, and was known for his quick wit, as well as his controversial stance on the Vietnam War. In 2005, he was crowned by Sports Illustrated as the "Sportsman of the Century," and was widely regarded as a cultural icon and hero to many. A humanitarian and philanthropist, he also founded the Muhammad Ali Parkinson Center in 1984. #TeacherAppreciationWeek: A Tale Of Two Teachers

bio: Cult film is a term used to describe movies that have a particularly devoted following. Cult films are often characterized by their unconventional or offbeat natures, as well as their ability to appeal to a small but dedicated group of fans. They may be low-budget, independently made, or outside the mainstream of commercial cinema. Cult films can also be a form of paracinema, which is a type of non-mainstream film that does not fit into the dominant film culture. They have a devoted following of fans who can quote and re-watch the film extensively. They often reappear on public-domain home video, on cable television and on the Internet. Cult films can also sometimes become popular within mainstream culture later on, and gain a wider following. #TheList: Top 10 movies to watch before you die

Wood has also been active in music, releasing several solo albums and collaborating with artists such as Marilyn Manson and Nate Ruess. She has been nominated for several prestigious awards including Golden Globe Award, Screen Actors Guild Award, and Emmy Award. #HackerWatch Security

bio: The Twilight Saga (film series) is a series of five romance fantasy films from Summit Entertainment based on the novels by Stephenie Meyer. The films star Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, and Taylor Lautner respectively, as Bella Swan, Edward Cullen, and Jacob Black. The first film, Twilight, was released in 2008 and grossed over $400 million worldwide. The sequel, New Moon, was released in 2009 and grossed over $700 million worldwide. The third film, Eclipse, was released in 2010 and grossed over $698 million worldwide. The final two films in the series, Breaking Dawn - Part 1 and Breaking Dawn - Part 2, were released in 2011 and 2012, grossing over $750 million and $829 million worldwide respectively. The series has grossed over $3.3 billion worldwide. The series was a commercial success and was praised for its performances, particularly Stewart and Pattinson's, as well as its music and visual style, but criticized for the quality of its screenplay and character development. #EggSperiment: Innovative Social Media Campaign Promotes Mental Health

bio: One More Light is the seventh studio album by American rock band Linkin Park, released on May 19, 2017 through Warner Bros. Records. It was produced by producers Andrew "Blue" Storm and Mike Shinoda. This album marks a departure from the band's nu metal roots and instead embraced a more alternative rock and electronic sound. The title track "One More Light" was released as the lead single on February 16, 2017 and features vocals from the American singer-songwriter Kiiara. The album was preceded by six other singles, including "Heavy," "Battle Symphony," and "Good Goodbye." The album received mixed reviews from critics, with many praising the band's reinvention, while others criticized the change in sound and lyrical themes. bio: Mango is the fruit of the mango tree. It is native to South Asia, particularly India, Bangladesh, and Pakistan, though it is now cultivated and consumed in many parts of the world. Mango is a juicy stone fruit, typically Round or oval with a smooth or rough skin. It is a rich source of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, and can be consumed in various forms, including ripe, unripe, dried, or in juices and candies. The mango's sweetness makes it popular as a dessert or a snack and its pulp is used to make juice, nectar, smoothies, and other drinks. In addition, mango leaves are used in traditional medicine due to their various health benefits, such as reducing fever, treating skin diseases, or aiding in digestion.

bio: Social justice refers to the fair distribution of resources, opportunities, and privileges within a society. It is a concept that emphasizes the inherent worth and dignity of all individuals, and seeks to address systemic inequalities and prejudices that prevent individuals and groups from achieving their full potential. Social justice advocates often work to challenge and change societal norms, institutions, and structures that perpetuate oppression and marginalization, and instead promote the fair and equitable treatment of all individuals. This can include efforts to advance civil rights, improve access to education, healthcare, and housing, address economic disparities, and challenge discrimination based on race, gender, sexual orientation, ability, and other factors. The pursuit of social justice is a fundamental objective of many social movements and is widely viewed as a key to building a more just, equitable, and compassionate society. ### What can I do to improve my English pronunciation?

bio: The Rev, also known as James Sullivan, was an American musician, songwriter, and record producer, best known as the co-founder, lead vocalist, keyboardist and songwriter for the American rock band Avenged Sevenfold. He was a highly skilled drummer and was known for his powerful and fast drumming style. He joined Avenged Sevenfold in 1999, co-writing many of the band's songs and he was also a co-producer for all of their albums. Following the release of their 2005 album, City Of Evil, The Rev gained a huge fan following and was regarded by many as one of the most talented drummers in heavy metal music, In 2009, he suddenly died of an accidental overdose of alcohol and oxycodone. from host en.wikipedia.org

bio: The Land Before Time is a series of American animated films produced by Universal Pictures and Amblin Entertainment. The first film in the series was released in 1988, and several direct-to-video sequels and television spin-offs have been produced since then. The films follow a young Apatosaurus named Littlefoot on his quest to find the mythical Great Valley. Along the way, he meets other young dinosaurs, and together they face various challenges such as facing Sharpes tooth, a T-Rex, and other dangers in order to reach the Great Valley. The films are known for their memorable characters, positive values, and catchy songs, and have become a beloved franchise among children and families. #1 Post by Fia » Mon Mar 19, 2018 11:49 am

bio: Ryan Gosling, (born November 12, 1980) is a Canadian actor, director, writer, and producer. He began his career as a child star on the Disney Channel's Mickey Mouse Club (1993–95) and went on to appear in other family-friendly programs, including Are You Afraid of the Dark? (1995) and Goosebumps (1996). He later achieved critical recognition in Half Nelson (2006), for which he received an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor, and further starred in Lars and the Real Girl (2007) and Blue Valentine (2010). He has since appeared in a variety of films, including Crazy, Stupid, Love (2011), The Place Beyond the Pines (2012), The Nice Guys (2016), and First Man (2018). He has been recognized for his work as a producer on the film The Slaughter Rule and the TV series The United States of Tara and has directed and written the films Lost River (2014) and the upcoming film, The Song of Scorpions. #3 in 2020's Top Female Musicians

bio: Robert Browning (7 May 1812 – 12 June 1889) was an English poet and playwright whose career was to dominate the Victorian age in poetry. Browning's poetry is known for its intellectual and social insights, and for its use of dramatic verse and monologue. Browning's early lifework demonstrated a strong inclination to literary art, and he lived in Italy for 14 years, where he collected materials for his poem "The Ring and the Book", which earned him a reputation as one of the greatest Victorian poets. In his later years, Browning's work largely focused on dramatic monologues, which he believed to be a new form for the Victorian era. import express from 'express';

bio: Blue-ringed octopus (Hapalochlaena lunulata) is a small, venomous octopus found in shallow, coastal waters of the Indo-Pacific region. It is a small, slender octopus with short arms and iridescent blue rings on its body. It is considered one of the most venomous marine animals with a single bite from this species capable of causing rapid death via paralysis of the respiratory system. The venom contains the neurotoxin haloine, which blocks nerve function and leads to respiratory paralysis, causing death within minutes. It is also known for its bioluminescent blue rings on its body, which it uses for both camouflage and communication. Despite its venom, the blue-ringed octopus is not aggressive and will only bite when threatened or provoked. #193 - The Great Firewall of China

bio: Tyra Banks (born December 4, 1973) is an American supermodel, media personality, actress, occasional singer, and businesswoman. Born in Inglewood, California, she began her career as a model at age 15. Banks was one of the first Black models to grace the cover of the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue and one of the first models of African descent to be featured on the cover of the Victoria's Secret catalog and annual Victoria's Secret Fashion Show. She also hosted her own talk show, The Tyra Banks Show, from 2005 to 2010, and was a judge on America's Next Top Model from 2003 to 2015. Banks is also the creator of the TZONE foundation, which focuses on teaching young people to be confident and embrace their individuality. #009: How to Avoid Burnout as a Health Care Provider 0

bio: Philip V of Spain (Spanish: Felipe V; 13 June 1683 – 9 July 1746) was King of Spain and the Spanish territories of Italy, Portugal, and the Two Sicilies, from 9 July 1700 until his death. He was the fifth son of Louis XIV of France and his wife, Queen Marie-Thérèse. During his reign, Philip V faced several challenges, including the ongoing War of Spanish Succession and the rise of Habsburg Austria as a rival power. bio: Singapore is an island city-state in Southeast Asia, located at the southern tip of the Malay Peninsula. It is a parliamentary republic with a diverse and multicultural population. Singapore's territory consists of the main island, commonly referred to as Singapore Island, and about 52 smaller islands. Since the 1960s, the country has been transformed from a developing to a developed country, with a thriving economy and world-class education system. Its standard of living is one of the highest in Asia and ranks highly in global comparisons. Singapore is known for its restrictions on free speech and has been criticized for its use of capital punishment, as well as its strict laws on drugs and public protests. Despite this, it is considered one of the safest and cleanest cities in the world, and it has one of the world's busiest ports. #!/usr/bin/env python

bio: Three Days of the Condor is a 1975 American political thriller film directed by Sydney Pollack and starring Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, and Cliff Robertson. The screenplay by Lorenzo Semple Jr. and David Rayfiel is a revisionist spy thriller that deals with the world of intelligence, particularly CIA operations. The film centers on the character of Joseph Turner, a book-loving CIA researcher who, while reading a book at the agency's library, unwittingly stumbles upon a secret plan for a military coup d'état. The ensuing events lead him to be targeted by a CIA hit squad, and Turner must use his knowledge of intelligence operations to evade and ultimately capture his pursuers. Despite mixed reviews from critics, Three Days of the Condor is considered a highly influential film in the action and spy genres, and has been cited by many filmmakers as an inspiration. The film was a box office success, grossing $22.5 million on a budget of $8.5 million. (Redirected from John C. Calhoun)

bio: French Open, officially known as the Roland Garros French Open, is a major tennis tournament held over a two-week period in May and June. It is the premier clay court tennis championship event in the world and the second of four annual Grand Slam tournaments. The event takes place at the Stade Roland Garros in Paris, France. The French Open is the only Grand Slam tournament that completes its championships in a single month. The tournament consists of men's and women's singles, men's and women's doubles, and mixed doubles. It is considered one of the most physically demanding tournaments in professional tennis due to the slow-playing surface of clay.

bio: Evonne Goolagong Cawley (born 3 July 1951) is an Australian former World No. 1 professional tennis player. She won an unprecedented seven Grand Slam singles titles and an additional five in women's doubles, both with her compatriot and close friend, Margaret Court. Her total of 14 Grand Slam titles places her equal-fifth on the list of all-time female Grand Slam title winners, and is the most titles won by any Australian player, male or female. Goolagong Cawley is also known for her contribution to Indigenous Australian causes, with her father being of Indigenous Australian descent and her mother of European Australian descent. #HeyGoogle, it's time to get personal

bio: Lupe Fiasco, born Wasalu Muhammad Jaco, is an American rapper, singer, and record producer. Raised in Chicago, Fiasco first became known as a vocalist within the local hip-hop scene before signing with Epic Records in 2006. He rose to fame after the success of his debut single "Superstar" featuring Matthew Santos. Fiasco's first album, Lupe Fiasco's Food & Liquor, was released in 2006 and received critical acclaim for its diverse and introspective lyrics. Its follow-up, Lupe Fiasco's The Cool, was released in 2007 and was also well received by music critics. Fiasco's fourth studio album, Lasers, was released in 2011 and featured the Grammy Award-winning single "The Show Goes On". His latest work is Drogas Wave, released in 2018. Fiasco has been praised for his emotional, introspective, and socially conscious songs that touch on a wide range of topics, including politics, religion, identity and relationships. #BlackLivesMatter Activists Disrupt Hillary Clinton Speech in South Carolina (VIDEO)

bio: Romelu Lukaku (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈroːmeルーカゥ], born 13 May 1993) is a Belgian professional footballer who plays as a striker for Inter Milan and the Belgium national team. He began his career with hometown club RSSC Anderlecht, making his professional debut at the age of 16, before moving to Chelsea in 2011. After two seasons with the club, he was sold to Everton for £28 million, where he played for four seasons before joining Manchester United for £75 million in 2017. In August 2019, he joined Inter Milan for a reported fee of £80 million. Lukaku has been capped 82 times for the Belgium national team, scoring 46 goals, and has represented his country at three World Cups and two European Championships. #119: Forgiving Yourself 0

bio: Twitter is a microblogging and social networking service that enables users to send and receive short 280-character messages called "tweets". It was created in March 2006 by Jack Dorsey, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams, and was launched in July of that year. Today, it is one of the largest social networking platforms in the world, with over 330 million active monthly users. The service has become a widely used tool for celebrities, politicians, and businesses to connect with their audiences and share their thoughts and messages with the world, as well as for users to share news, ideas, and other content with people who share similar interests. The platform is also known for its real-time information flow and has been credited as a tool for breaking news and sparking global conversations. ##What is this about?

bio: Alien: Covenant is a 2017 science fiction horror film directed by Ridley Scott, written by John Logan and Dante Harper, and starring Michael Fassbender, Katherine Waterston, and Billy Crudup. It is the second film in the Alien: Paradise series and served as a sequel to Prometheus (2012) and a prequel to the original Alien (1979). The film follows the colony ship Covenant, which is on a mission to establish humanity's first foothold on a remote planet, an uncharted paradise. But when a threat arises, the crew members are forced to defend themselves against the hostile environment and a creature that is more menacing than anything they have faced before.

bio: Prince (musician) was an American singer, songwriter, musician, record producer and actor. Known as one of the most iconic and influential artists of the 20th century, Prince was known for his unique blend of funk, rock, R&B, and pop music. He released numerous albums throughout his career and was known for his dynamic live performances, in which he played numerous instruments and was known for his high energy. Some of his most well-known songs include "Purple Rain", "1999", "When Doves Cry", "Let's Go Crazy" and "Kiss". Prince was renowned for his flamboyant stage presence and fashion sense, and was known for his prolific work ethic, often releasing multiple albums per year and touring extensively. He was highly influential in the music industry and was known for his advocacy of independent label ownership and his efforts to combat piracy. He died on April 21, 2016, at the age of 57, leaving behind a legacy as one of the most innovative and influential artists of all time. #36 - G.I. Joe Retaliation Review

bio: Kim Basinger is an American actress and model. She began her acting career in the 1970s and rose to prominence in the 1980s with roles in the films "The Natural", "Batman", and "L.A. Confidential", for which she won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. She made her film debut in the science-fiction film "I Dream of Jeannie" in 1985. She later starred in other films such as "9 1/2 Weeks", "Batman", "The Marrying Man", "The Career of Nikki Haskell", "The Getaway", and "L.A. Confidential". Basinger has been married to actor and writer Alec Baldwin since 1993, and the couple has a daughter together. She has been a vegan since 1992. bio: David Bowie (1947-2016) was an English singer, songwriter, actor, and musician who is widely regarded as one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century. He was a leading figure in the glam rock movement of the 1970s and is best known for his alter ego Ziggy Stardust, the persona he created and portrayed during his live performances in the early 1970s. Throughout his career, Bowie displayed an unparalleled ability to reinvent himself, musically, visually, and in his personal life, pushing the boundaries of gender, sexuality, and racial identity. His diverse range of musical styles and genres, including rock, pop, art rock, electronic, and the experimental, marked a significant departure from the prevailing Rock 'n' Roll orthodoxy. Bowie's impact and significance have been widely recognised and celebrated by critics, artists, and the public alike. #ReleaseBlitz for Blackbird by D.A. Schilling @dschillingwrites @GiveMeBooksPR

Starbucks is known for its coffee and coffee-related products, including its flagship item, espresso-based beverages. The company operates a chain of coffee houses worldwide, including Starbucks-branded outlets and others through subsidiary companies. Starbucks also sells hot and cold drinks, including lattes, cappuccinos, espresso, iced tea, and a variety of pastries and snacks. bio: River Phoenix (born River Jude Bottom; August 23, 1970 – October 31, 1993) was an American actor, musician, and activist. He was a member of the Phoenix family, a famous acting family, and began his acting career at the age of 10, appearing in television commercials and guest roles in numerous television shows. His first film role came in 1984, in the film The Mosquito Coast, and he starred in several other films throughout the 1980s and 1990s, including Stand by Me, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade, and My Own Private Idaho. Phoenix also pursued a music career, with an album released in 1988 and a single released in 1990. Off-screen, he was known for his advocacy for a variety of political and social causes, including animal rights, environmentalism, and vegetarianism. At the age of 23, Phoenix died from a drug overdose outside a nightclub in Hollywood. #TheGreatBirthdayBash

bio: Bal Gangadhar Tilak (1856 – 1920) was an Indian nationalist, teacher, and journalist, who played an important role in the Indian Independence Movement. Tilak is known for his role in uniting Indian society and politics on the basis of the Swaraj (self-rule) principle. He was one of the first leaders of the independence movement who advocated for Swaraj as a means of achieving freedom from British rule, and his ideas and leadership greatly influenced the Indian National Congress and other Indian political organizations. He served several prison terms for his political activism and on January 1, 1920, Tilak passed away in Mumbai due to chronic diabetes, aged 64. #BlogTour #Excerpt Reveal for J. Kenner's STARRED REVIEW BOOK 5 in The Fix Series - THE FIX UP - Releases 6/13/17! @juliekenner @InkslingerPR #ContemporaryRomance

bio: Renaissance is a term used to refer to a period in European history, lasting from the 14th to the 17th century, marking the transition from the Middle Ages to modernity. The term is also used to describe the artistic, literary, and scientific movement that occurred during this period. This cultural movement was characterized by a revival of interest in the classical learning, values, and aesthetics of ancient Greece and Rome. The Renaissance period saw significant advances in science, exploration, art, and literature, and is often considered the beginning of the Early Modern period. Some of the most renowned figures of the Renaissance include Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Raphael. package java.sql;

bio: Agatha Christie was an English writer of crime novels, short stories and plays. She also wrote romance novels under the pseudonym Mary Westmacott. She is best known for her detective fiction, particularly those featuring Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple, which have sold over 2 billion copies and have been translated into over 100 languages. She is the best-selling author of all time and has had at least one novel appear in every British best-seller list for the past five decades. She was made a Dame by Queen Elizabeth II in 1971. #65: Mentalism – Part 2 – The Power of Imagery by Thomas Blakeley

bio: Fight Club is a 1996 novel by Chuck Palahniuk. It tells the story of an unnamed protagonist suffering from insomnia, who is dissatisfied with his white-collar job and incomplete life. The story follows the formation of an underground fight club as a means of escaping the protagonist's mundane and depressing life. As the fight club grows, it evolves into Project Mayhem, a terrorist organization bent on destroying consumerism and contemporary culture. The novel has been adapted into a 1999 film of the same name. Though controversial due to its themes of violence and masculinity, Fight Club has been widely discussed and analyzed, and is considered a contemporary classic in American literature. #254 – An Interview with James Veitch

bio: Doc Holliday (1851–1887) was an American dentist, gambler, and gunfighter of the American Old West frontier who is best known for his involvement in the Gunfight at the O.K. Corral. Born in Griffin, Georgia, Holliday received a degree in dentistry from the Pennsylvania College of Dental Surgery before moving to the American West, where he developed a reputation as a skilled dentist and a hazardous gambler. He was known to have been a good poker player and had a gambling problem. He also spent time in the cattle industry, which is likely where he acquired his reputation as a deadly gunslinger. Holliday was known to have been a close friend of the gunfighter and gambler Wyatt Earp, and was a participant in the famous gunfight in Tombstone, Arizona, along with Earp and his brothers. #4 in Best Things To Do in Seattle

bio: Corey Taylor is an American musician, songwriter, and author. He is best known as the lead vocalist, lyricist, and one of the guitarists of the American heavy metal band Slipknot as well as the former lead vocalist of the American nu-metal band Stone Sour. Taylor's singing ability has been consistently praised by both fans and critics, with his vocal range spanning four octaves and his powerful, emotive delivery making him a standout in the genre. Taylor also has an extensive solo career, having released two albums, 2003's "Enjoy the Silence" and 2004's "Live with the Preservation Hall Jazz Band". He has released several books, including his memoir "Seven: Deep, Dark Secrets" and the follow-up "A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Heaven". #58 - The Power of Focus

bio: Back to the Future Part II is a 1989 American science fiction film and the second installment in the Back to the Future franchise. It was directed by Robert Zemeckis and written by Bob Gale. It stars Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Thomas F. Wilson, and Lea Thompson. It was released on November 22, 1989. The film grossed $331 million worldwide and became the highest-grossing film of 1989. The film follows Marty McFly (Michael J. Fox) who travels back to 1955 in a time machine built by his scientist friend Doc Brown (Christopher Lloyd). However, an interference from an alternative 1955 alters the timeline and Marty must correct the events before the clock strikes 12:00am on the night of November 12, 1955 to ensure that his parents meet and fall in love, otherwise he will cease to exist. The film was nominated for three Academy Awards and two BAFTA awards. #946: “Gotta Find a Bright Spot” by Joe Sun

bio: The Matrix Revolutions is a 2003 science fiction film and the third installment in The Matrix series written and directed by the Wachowskis. It was released six months after the second installment, The Matrix Reloaded. The Matrix Revolutions begins with the human city of Zion preparing for the imminent attack of the machines, who are now aware of the prophecy of the One. Thomas Anderson, also known as Neo, is still hailed as the hero but has yet to fulfill his destiny, and more importantly, Trinity's faith in him is dwindling. Neo, Trinity, and Morpheus set out to unplug the Key Maker, a Program that can unlock any lock in the Matrix. However, they are ambushed by Agents and Trinity is captured. Neo must now face the Machine City on his own. Meanwhile, Zion falls under attack and the rebels must mount a desperate defense. The Matrix Revolutions grossed $427 million worldwide and received mixed reviews. It was nominated for four Academy Awards but did not win any. #EggRevolution: Indian social media hails woman’s defiant act

bio: Charles Marie de La Condamine (4 September 1701 – 4 February 1774) was a French mathematician, geographer, and naturalist. He is best known for his expedition to the Amazon Rainforest between 1735 and 1743, where he led an expedition to measure the circumference of the Earth, and for discovering the Quito earthquake of 1797, which he correctly interpreted as a sign of tectonic activity. He made significant discoveries in mathematics, including the determination of a value for π to 14 decimal places. La Condamine was also a member of the French Academy of Sciences and was elected a foreign member of the Royal Society in 1743.

bio: Sarrainodu (English: Hero) is a 2016 Indian Telugu-language action film co-written and directed by Boyapati Srinu. It features Allu Arjun, Rakul Preet Singh, and Catherine Tresa in the lead roles. The film revolves around a gangster who is a loyal follower of a politician. When he falls in love with the politician's daughter, he faces opposition from his own brother. The film was produced by Allu Aravind under the banner of Geetha Arts. The soundtrack was composed by S. Thaman. It received positive reviews from critics and was a commercial success, grossing over INR 1.5 billion (US$20 million) worldwide. #32: Guns, Gangs, Violence & the State

bio: Solange Knowles, also known mononymously as Solange, is an American singer, songwriter, record producer, and actress. Knowles was raised in Houston, Texas, and started her singing career as a child performing in her church choir. At the age of 16, she was signed to the music label Sony Music. Her debut album, Solo Star (2002), was released under the minor music label Orchard, but was not widely successful. In 2007, Knowles signed to the music group Destiny's Child's manager, Mathew Knowles' record label, Music World Entertainment. After several delay, she released her second studio album, Sol-Angel and the Hadley St. Dreams (2008), to critical acclaim. In 2012, Knowles released her third studio album, True, and in 2019, she released her latest album, When I Get Home. She also wrote and directed the music video for her song "Don't Touch My Hair" and released the film, When I Get Home, in 2019.

bio: Edgar Allan Poe (January 19, 1809 – October 7, 1849) was an American writer, editor, and literary critic, considered part of the American Romantic Movement. Best known for his tales of the macabre and his poetry, Poe was one of the earliest American practitioners of the short story, as well as a proponent of the detective fiction genre. He is also known for his dark, atmospheric short stories and poems, and his literary criticism. Poe's writing often features an atmospheric quality and a sense of the mysterious and melancholic, and his works are often concerned with questions of death, the supernatural, and the relationship between the living and the dead.

bio: Gerard Butler is a Scottish actor, singer, and model. After pursuing a career as an actor in London, he made his film debut as the title character in the biographical drama film "Dear Frankie" (2004) and then appeared in the historical romance film "The Phantom of the Opera" (2004), among others. bio: Northeast megalopolis is a megalopolis or megalopolis-in-the-making that stretches from Boston to Washington, D.C., along the northeastern seaboard of the United States. It is the most urbanized and densely populated region in the United States and includes over 20 metropolitan areas, with a total population of over 50 million people. The region is home to several major commercial, financial, and cultural centers, including New York City, Boston, Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington, D.C., and Richmond, among many others. The Northeast megalopolis is known for its dense concentration of people, high levels of economic activity, cultural diversity, and significant historical, cultural, and educational resources. #1 CBD Isolate

bio: Phantoms (film) is a 1998 American horror film directed by Joe Chappelle, based on the novel of the same name by Dean Koontz. It stars Peter O'Toole, Rose McGowan, and Joanna Going as the main characters. It's a story about a small Californian town that is attacked by mysterious entities that can take over the bodies of their victims. When a young psychic woman named Kit (McGowan) arrives in the town, she and a journalist (O'Toole) team up to uncover the truth behind the creatures and their connection to the town's past. The film received a negative reception from critics and was a box-office bomb, grossing only $6.3 million against its production budget of $35 million, making it one of the biggest bombs of 1998. #287: How to Find Business Angels and Investors to Finance Your Startup, with Fabrice Hamaide

bio: The Host (2013 film) is a monster film directed by Bong Joon-ho, adapted from the Stephenie Meyer's novel of the same name. It was written by Bong and Jon Ronson, and stars Song Kang-ho, Bae Doona and Go Ah-sung as the main characters. The story follows a father and his family who make a pact to keep their curse a secret while living in Seoul, but their lives are shattered when a monstrous creature known as "The Host" attacks them. The film was met with critical acclaim, particularly for its direction, visual effects, and themes, and it was considered as a box office hit, grossing over $86 million worldwide on a budget of $11 million. The film was nominated for several awards, including the Palme d'Or at the 2006 Cannes Film Festival and it was the first commercial South Korean film to be shot entirely in English. #654 - The Witching Hour

bio: The Twilight Saga (film series) is a series of five romantic fantasy films from Summit Entertainment based on the four novels of the same name by Stephenie Meyer. The films star Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, and Taylor Lautner and follow the romantic adventures of Bella Swan (Stewart) and her relationship with vampire Edward Cullen (Pattinson) and werewolf Jacob Black (Lautner). The first film, Twilight, was released in 2008, and the second, New Moon, in 2009. The third, Eclipse, was released in 2010, followed by the fourth, Breaking Dawn – Part 1, in 2011, and the fifth and final film, Breaking Dawn – Part 2, in 2012. The series was a commercial success, with the four films grossing over $3.3 billion at the worldwide box office. Collectively, the films were generally criticized for their dialogue, acting and special effects but despite that became a cultural and commercial phenomenon, leading to extensive merchandising, and spin-offs of the franchise. #VeteranOfTheDay John Canfield: The Marine who fought in a famous tank battle in the Pacific Theater during World War II and later founded and became president of a college

It is the fourth installment of the live-action Transformers film series and a reboot of the series. bio: Jessica Chastain (born March 24, 1977) is an American actress and film producer. Chastain gained fame for her roles in films such as The Help (2011), Zero Dark Thirty (2012), for which she was nominated for an Academy Award, and Interstellar (2014). Other notable films include The Martian (2015), Miss Sloane (2016), and the title role in the television series Penny Dreadful (2014–2016). She has also starred in the Broadway play The Heiress (2012) and as Beverly Marsh in the film adaptation of Stephen King's It (2017). Time magazine named her one of the 100 most influential people in the world in 2012. She has received numerous accolades, including a Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actress and a Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actress. #333333color, silver

bio: National Council for Peace and Order (NCPO) is the military junta that has been governing Thailand since the 2014 coup d'état. The junta, also known as the National Council for Peace and Order and the National Reform Council, was established by the Royal Thai Armed Forces following the coup that overthrew the elected government of Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra. In addition to implementing a new constitution, the junta has taken steps to suppress political dissent, restrict freedom of speech and the press, and detain political opponents. bio: Lumen Pierce is a fictional character in the video game series Undertale. He is the prince of the Underground, a dimension inhabited by monsters, and the son of King Asgore Dreemurr and Queen Toriel. Lumen's soul is a shy and anxious person who doesn't know how to express feelings. He was kidnapped by a human named Alphys, who wished for him to be the science experiment in "Temmie Village". Lumen was initially portrayed as a villain in the game, serving as the main antagonist of the True Pacifist route and the primary opponent of the player character in the battle against Asriel Dreemurr. However, in the True Labyrinth route, Lumen becomes playable and it is revealed that he has been struggling with inner turmoil due to the lack of understanding from other monsters and his conflicted feelings towards his father. package archive packages, that are installed outside your home directory.

bio: Soundgarden was an American rock band formed in Seattle, Washington, in 1984. The band consisted of Chris Cornell (vocals and main songwriter), Kim Thayil (guitar), Matt Cameron (drums), and Ben Shepherd (bass). Soundgarden broke up in 1997 and later reformed in 2010. The band was one of the seminal grunge bands of the early 1990s, releasing albums such as "Ultramega OK" (1988), "Louder Than Love" (1989), "Badmotorfinger" (1991), and "Superunknown" (1994). Soundgarden's sound was characterized by Cornell's powerful vocals and a mix of heavy metal and grunge aesthetics, and they contributed to the development of alternative rock. During their career, the band had a number of hit singles, including "Black Hole Sun," "Spoonman," "Fell on Black Days," and "The Day I Tried to Live." Soundgarden's style and influence continue to be felt in heavy rock and grunge music today. #BookReview The Gigantic Beard That Was Evil by Stephen Collins

bio: Bob Arum is an American boxing promoter, founder and CEO of Top Rank, a boxing promotion company. He was born in 1931 in New York City. He began his career as a lawyer and then entered the boxing industry as a promoter in the 1970s. He has promoted many notable fights, including the "Fight of the Century" between Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier and the "Thrilla in Manila" between Ali and Frazier. He has also been the promoter for fighters such as Oscar De La Hoya, Mike Tyson, and Manny Pacquiao. He has been inducted into the International Boxing Hall of Fame in 1994. #NewRelease #Giveaway for #Romance "The Cowboy's E-Mail Order Bride" by Linda Bridey

bio: Plato (427/428 – 348/347 BC) was an Athenian philosopher, mathematician, student of Socrates, and teacher of Aristotle. He is widely believed to be one of the most pivotal figures in the development of philosophy, particularly in the West, and is generally viewed as one of the most important founding figures in Western philosophy. In the foundations of his philosophy lie the principles of his dialectic method, which was to become the foundation for western philosophy, and his theory of Forms, or Ideas. His sophisticated use of rhetoric, in both writing and speech, set him in the tradition of the educated speakers and writers of his time. #MeToo Movement Spreads Beyond Hollywood

bio: Johnny Mnemonic (film) is a 1995 cyberpunk film co-written and directed by Robert Longo. It is based on the short story "Johnny Mnemonic" by William Gibson and stars Keanu Reeves as the title character, a Johnny-cycle courier in future Toronto who is offered a cyborg-style "memory upgrade" to help him store sensitive data. However, the data lodges in his brain, making him a target of various factions who seek to remove the information. The film also stars Dina Meyer, Robert Patrick, and Takeshi Kitano, and features an original score by Elliott Goldenthal. The film initially underperformed at the box office and received mixed reviews from critics, but has since become a cult classic. #TurkeyTuesday: Ankara!

bio: Daniel Craig is an English actor, best known for playing the role of James Bond in the 2006 film Casino Royale, and as Ian Fleming's superspy in the following four films, Quantum of Solace (2008), Skyfall (2012), Spectre (2015) and No Time To Die (2020). He is the first actor to be cast for the 007 role under the production of Eon Productions at the age of 38, and 18 years older than the actor who played the role before him, Pierce Brosnan. bio: Constantine (film) is a 2005 American supernatural action-thriller film directed by Francis Lawrence, with screenplay adaptation by Kevin Brodbin and Frank A. Cappello. The film stars Keanu Reeves as John Constantine, a morally ambiguous occult detective who sets out to trade his soul for a chance at salvation, but becomes embroiled in a larger conflict between good and evil forces. The film also co-stars Rachel Weisz, Shia LaBeouf, and Djimon Hounsou, and features Pete Postlethwaite, Tilda Swinton, and Max Baker in supporting roles. It received mixed reviews from critics and fans alike. The film's box office performance was modest, making a profit of $130 million on a budget of $100 million, but was not well received by critics or fans of the original comic book. package net.docusign.api.docs.impl;

bio: Nikita (TV series) is a French-Canadian action-thriller television series that aired from 1997 to 2001. The series was created by Joaquim Silva and based on the 1990 French film La Femme Nikita. It stars Peta Wilson as Nikita, a former criminal who, after being rescued from death row, is recruited to become an agent for a secret government organization known as Division, which fights against criminal and terrorist organizations. Over the course of the series, Nikita must deal with her own past crimes while also trying to overcome the various challenges and enemies she encounters as an operative. The show was widely praised for its strong female lead, action sequences, and dark tone, and remains a cult classic among fans of the action and spy genres. #Pope Francis "We must learn to listen, to respect and to appreciate our differences." #Angelus

bio: Republic of Ireland, also known as Ireland, is a country in northwestern Europe. It is also known as the Emerald Isle due to its lush green landscapes and is the world's second-largest island after Australia. It shares a border with Northern Ireland, a part of the United Kingdom, and is otherwise surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean. The capital is Dublin, and the population is approximately 4.9 million. The official language is Irish, and English is also widely spoken. The currency is the euro. The country has a diverse culture that includes traditional music, sports, and literature. The country has a modern economy that is highly dependent on trade, particularly with the European Union, and is a member of the European Union and the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development.

bio: Winter Passing is a 2018 American drama film directed by Adam Rapp, based on his play of the same name. The film stars Zeger Van Straten, Rosanna Arquette, Jena Malone, and Judith Light. It follows a young woman named Reese who returns home to rural Mississippi following the death of her estranged mother. She learns that she has inherited the family home and meets her half-sister, Lida, whom she has never met before. The two women form a close bond and try to build a relationship but struggle with their past and present conflicts. The film premiered at the 2018 Provincetown International Film Festival and was released on Amazon Prime Video in 2021. It received praise for its performances and Rapp's direction, but some criticism for its slow pacing. #BookReview: A Gentleman in Moscow by Amor Towles
